questions.question_text: Which of the following is the GREATEST benefit of performing a tabletop exercise of the business continuity plan (BCP)?

choices.D: It allows for greater participation and planning from the business side.
choices.B: It identifies appropriate follow-up work to address shortcomings in the plan.
choices.A: It helps in assessing the availability of compatible backup hardware.
choices.C: It provides a low-cost method of assessing the BCP’s completeness.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B: Because it ensures the BCP is practically useful and actionable, which is the ultimate goal of testing and validation in business continuity management.
Regarding option C: Yes, tabletop exercises are low-cost compared to full functional or technical recovery tests. But it’s not the greatest benefit! Cost is secondary here.

Selected Answer: C
I vote C. Tabletop exercise doesn't only help us to assess the BCP's completeness, but it also does it at a low cost.

questions.question_text: The MAIN reason for having senior management review and approve an information security strategic plan is to ensure:
Which of the following is the BEST defense against a brute force attack?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A brute force attack is a method of guessing a password or other authentication method by trying every possible combination of characters. To defend against this type of attack, an Intruder detection lockout is used. This mechanism automatically locks out an account after a certain number of failed login attempts, thus preventing the attacker from guessing the correct password. This technique helps to protect the system from unauthorized access, and also allows the organization to detect and respond to attempted breaches.

Selected Answer: A
in this case lockout is the best option

A.
Intruder detection lockout is a practical and effective defense mechanism against brute force attacks because it limits an attacker's ability to repeatedly guess passwords, making it significantly harder for them to compromise an account through trial and error.
